element.name: Dublin's Stadia Series 1 - The National Stadium by Toffee Man, Traditional Cache (1/1)

center.font: Visit the Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE

element.long-description:
"Dublin's Stadia Series 1 - The National Stadium" - this cache is one of seven in the series. The stadia are the National stadia for their respective sports.
The series consists of:
Croke Park Gaelic Football & Hurling
The Aviva Stadium Soccer & Rugby
The RDS Ballsbridge Show Jumping
Morton Stadium Athletics
The National Basketball Arena Basketball
The National Stadium SCR Boxing
The National Aquatic Centre Swimming
The series will bring you to stadia, both old and new, of Dublin city and will hopefully give you an appreciation for the love of all sport that is alive, not only in this city, but in the country in general. The various venues are of different ages and sizes. They are impressive and imposing structures within their surrounding localities.
The National Stadium
The National Stadium (Irish: An Staidiam Náisiúnta) is one of Ireland’s best known boxing venues.The venue is situated between Clanbrassil Street to the east and Dolphin's Barn to the west on the South Circular Road, Dublin 8.The National Stadium was the first purpose built boxing stadium in the world and was opened in 1939.The stadium is owned by the Irish Amateur Boxing Association (IABA) and has been used by the IABA for over 60 years as the venue for their national and international contests.
The stadium stages Amateur and Professional Boxing and Professional Wrestling bouts as well as providing facilities for music concerts, conferences and corporate hospitality events.
The capacity of the stadium is 2,080 for music events, which is reduced to 1,954 for boxing and wrestling events to accommodate the wrestling/boxing ring. The Ringside club seats up to 300 people for parties or sit down dining but some junior boxing events also take place here.
In December 1999, the then minister for the Department of Art, Sports and Tourism. Dr. James McDaid, announced a IR£1.3m (€1.6m) grant under the Sports Capital Programme to undertake the refurbishment of the stadium. The two-storey building was provided with a new grey coloured limestone façade during the refurbishment..
The cache is a micro. Don't forget to bring your own pen.
Stealth is required in this urban location. Please be aware of the many people who pass by this busy spot, and replace the cache exactly as you found it, ensuring it is not visible.
element.url-name: Dublin's Stadia Series 1 - The National Stadium

ul.li:
2010-05-26T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by tmob
We looked for this cache during our holidays in Ireland. Six fantastic days, 1800kms driven, and a bunch of caches found. Definitely a great way to get to know this beautiful island!
It was getting late, and we were not in the mood.
Thanks for this one... Greetings from Portugal

2010-05-24T19:00:00Z : Found it by THE_Chris
I didnt know Dublin had a boxing arena, and evidentally neither did the group of thugs who were having a bare knuckle fight outside the venue when I got there. I camped out on the other side of the road and it turned out it was just a group of friends having a laugh. More of them turned up and went quickly to the off-licence. I took the opportunity and grabbed the cache. Nice easy find. TFTC.

2010-05-15T19:00:00Z : Found it by AbbeyAckbar
(#635 @ 14:15) Through a course I'm studying I've been attending classes held in Griffith college next door throughout the year. I had no idea this stadium was right beside it and I was here years ago at my first ever concert 'Dina Carroll' back in 1993! I was here a couple of weeks ago and I tried to get the cache then but there was some event going on at the stadium and it was far too busy to go looking for it. Today, thankfully, the area was muggle free, that is except for my muggle classmate who accompanied me on the hunt for this cache. She had never heard of geocaching before and I think she found it interesting or amusing at the very least [:o)] Why is it so hard to explain to people the love of signing a piece of paper you find in a container hidden anywere in the world?! I was happy to see the note accompanying the logsheet explaining geocaching so I could show her. Signed log and replaced as found.
TFTC [:)]

2010-05-09T19:00:00Z : Found it by Spark_ie
Nice quick find, and now not my nearest cache anymore ! TFTC, Spark_ie

2010-04-28T19:00:00Z : Found it by Ravenheart
Found this one quite easily TFTC.[:)]

wpt.desc: Dublin's Stadia Series 1 - The National Stadium by Toffee Man, Traditional Cache (1/1)
